ingredients: 500g seeraga samba rice (short-grain rice unique to Ambur Biryani)
3 tablespoons gingelly oil (Indian sesame oil – adds distinctive flavor)
10-12 dried red chillies (soaked and ground to a paste)
A handful of chopped coriander leaves
A handful of chopped mint leaves
Water as needed for cooking rice

steps.title: Rinse and Soak Rice
steps.description: Rinse seeraga samba rice 2–3 times until the water runs clear. Soak it in water for 30 minutes.

steps.title: Soak Red Chillies
steps.description: Soak 10–12 dried red chillies in hot water for 10–15 minutes to soften them.

steps.title: Grind Red Chilli Paste
steps.description: Grind the soaked chillies into a smooth paste using minimal water.

steps.title: Heat Oil and Ghee
steps.description: In a heavy-bottomed pot, heat gingelly oil and ghee together on medium flame.

steps.title: Fry Whole Spices
steps.description: Add cloves, cardamom, cinnamon, bay leaf, and fennel seeds. Sauté until fragrant.

steps.title: Sauté Onions
steps.description: Add thinly sliced onions and fry until golden brown, stirring often to avoid burning.

steps.title: Add Ginger-Garlic Paste
steps.description: Stir in ginger paste and garlic paste. Cook for 1–2 minutes until the raw smell disappears.

steps.title: Cook Tomatoes
steps.description: Add chopped tomatoes and cook until they turn soft and the oil starts to separate.

steps.title: Add Chilli Paste and Turmeric
steps.description: Mix in the ground red chilli paste and turmeric powder. Sauté for 3–4 minutes.

steps.title: Add Yogurt and Herbs
steps.description: Stir in thick curd, mint leaves, and coriander leaves. Cook for 2–3 minutes until well combined.

steps.title: Add Meat and Salt
steps.description: Add cleaned mutton or chicken. Season with salt. Stir well to coat the meat with the masala.

steps.title: Cook Meat Until Tender
steps.description: Cover and cook the meat on medium heat until it is tender and oil begins to separate from the masala. Stir occasionally.

steps.title: Boil Water for Rice
steps.description: In a separate large pot, bring enough water to a boil. Add a pinch of salt.

steps.title: Cook Rice Until 80% Done
steps.description: Add the soaked rice to boiling water and cook until it's about 80% cooked. The grains should be firm but cooked through.

steps.title: Drain Rice
steps.description: Drain the rice immediately using a colander and set aside.

steps.title: Layer Rice Over Meat
steps.description: Spread the semi-cooked rice evenly over the cooked meat masala in the pot.

steps.title: Add Garnishes
steps.description: Drizzle lemon juice over the rice. Sprinkle some mint and coriander leaves for extra aroma.

steps.title: Seal and Dum Cook
steps.description: Cover the pot tightly with a lid (use dough or foil for a better seal). Cook on a low flame for 15–20 minutes (dum cooking).

steps.title: Rest the Biryani
steps.description: Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes before opening the lid.

steps.title: Gently Mix and Serve
steps.description: Gently fluff and mix the biryani from the sides without breaking the rice. Serve hot with brinjal curry and raita.
